div.p: The image shows workers in a citrus packing house, better known as Sunkist, in Ontario. The citrus industry became a crucial part of Ontario’s development.. It not only allured new settlers due to the wealth citrus yards brought to its growers, it also provided job opportunities for those who did not have the resources to own land. Low income settlers or long term inhabitant, often of Mexican descent, found jobs either in the citrus field or in the packing houses. The citrus industry also played a key role in segregating people based on race, which is still reflected in settling patterns up to the present day. Although the Sunkist packing house closed in 2008 and Ontario does not rely on citrus as its main product, it still provides most of its residents with industrial and manufacturing jobs.

note.p: The citrus industry allured new settlers due to its prosperity and also provided jobs for those who did not own land
